intro: Garhadiolus angulosus, commonly known as the angular garhadiolus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and angular, giving it its common name, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Garhadiolus angulosus is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
